results.title: Amplifying effect of chronic lisinopril therapy on diastolic function and the angiotensin-(1-7) Axis by the G1 agonist in ovariectomized spontaneously hypertensive rats.
results.text_hl: We conclude that activating @GENE_GPER1 @GENE_171104 @@@GPER@@@ with G1 augments components of the cardiac RAS and improves diastolic function without lowering blood pressure, and that @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@-induced blood pressure control and @<m>DISEASE_Heart_Neoplasms</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006338 @@@cardiac alterations@@@ in OVX SHR are permissive in facilitating G1 to augment Ang-(1-7) in serum, thereby strengthening its cardioprotective benefits.

citations.NLM: Sun X, Wang H, Hodge H, Wright KN, Ahmad S, Ferrario CM, Groban L. Amplifying effect of chronic lisinopril therapy on diastolic function and the angiotensin-(1-7) Axis by the G1 agonist in ovariectomized spontaneously hypertensive rats. Transl Res. 2021 Sep;235():62-76. PMID: 33915312
citations.BibTeX: @article{33915312, title={Amplifying effect of chronic lisinopril therapy on diastolic function and the angiotensin-(1-7) Axis by the G1 agonist in ovariectomized spontaneously hypertensive rats.}, author={Sun X and Wang H and Hodge H and Wright KN and Ahmad S and Ferrario CM and Groban L}, journal={Transl Res}, volume={235}, pages={62-76}}

results.title: ACE inhibition and protection from doxorubicin-induced cardiotoxicity in the rat.
results.text_hl: Using dose levels (0.1 mg/kg/day and 10 mg/kg/day) which inhibits partially (about 50%) or almost totally (about 80%) serum @GENE_ACE @GENE_24310 @@@angiotensin converting enzyme@@@, we evaluated the effects of @CHEMICAL_zofenopril @CHEMICAL_MESH:C044958 @@@zofenopril@@@ and @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ in preventing @<m>DISEASE_Heart_Neoplasms</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006338 @@@cardiac alterations@@@ (@DISEASE_Long_QT_Syndrome @DISEASE_MESH:D008133 @@@QalphaT prolongation@@@) induced by chronic treatment with @CHEMICAL_Doxorubicin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D004317 @@@doxorubicin@@@ (1.5 mg/kg q7dx5 i.v.).

citations.NLM: Sacco G, Mario B, Lopez G, Evangelista S, Manzini S, Maggi CA. ACE inhibition and protection from doxorubicin-induced cardiotoxicity in the rat. Vascul Pharmacol. 2009 May-Jun;50(5-6):166-70. PMID: 19344651
citations.BibTeX: @article{19344651, title={ACE inhibition and protection from doxorubicin-induced cardiotoxicity in the rat.}, author={Sacco G and Mario B and Lopez G and Evangelista S and Manzini S and Maggi CA}, journal={Vascul Pharmacol}, volume={50}, number={5-6}, pages={166-70}}
